40. According to Jesus, believers who forgive the sins of 
others will 
A. enter the Kingdom of God B. be forgiven by God 
C. receive a crown of life. D. inherit the earth. 
 
41. In the parable of the wheat and the tares, the bad seed 
was sowed by the 
A. Devil B. Scribes C. Pharisees D. Sadducees. 
 
42. According to Paul, generosity produces. 
A. righteousness B. thanksgiving to God C. salvation 
D. the grace of God 
 
43. ‘Is it not they who blasphem the honourable name which 
was invoked over you?’According to James in the state 
ment above, they refers to the 
A. principalities B. needy C. authorities D. rich. 
 
44. Paul reminded the Thessalonians that he did not eat 
anyone’s bread without paying for it. This statement 
teaches. 
A. self respect  B. creativityC. hardwork D. humility. 
 
45. According to Paul, he who loves his neighbour has 
A. eternal life B. overcome all evils C. fulfilled the law. 
D. peace with God. 
 
46. Paul declares in Romans that as by one man’s 
disobedience many were made sinners, by one man’s 
obedience many will 
A. be made righteous B. be made pure C. became 
steadfast in faith D. become loyal to God. 
47. According to James, the prayer of a righteous man 
A. can cleanse his sins B. has saving power 
C. can move mountains D. has great power in its 
effects. 
48. ‘…. the day of the Lord will come like a thief in the 
night.’ The day of the Lord in the statement above 
refers to the day of 
A. retribution B. repentance 
C. judgement D. tribulation. 
 
49. Peter urges Christians to live as free men without 
necessarily using their freedom as a pretex for 
A. evil B. immorality 
C. greed D. partiality. 
 
50. Those that have been baptized into Jesus Christ, 
according to Paul, are 
A. cleansed of their sins  B   baptized into His death 
C sanctified in Him D. baptized into the Christian fold. 
 
 
  CHRISTIAN  RELIGIOUS  KNOWLEDGE 2001

A. He set up a monument for himself 
B. He returned to Shiloh 
C. He offered sacrifices to god 
D. He repented to his sins

them…” the statement above was made by the 
Egyptian when 
A. Moses stretched out his hand over the sea 
B. their chariots were clogged in the sea 
C. the LORD drove the sea back by a strong 
east wind. 
D. the angel of God stood between them and 
Hebrews 
 
3. Moses told the Israelites that the LORD would give 
them flesh in the evening and bread in the morning 
because he had 
A. heard their prayers 
B. seen their suffering 
C. promised to feed them 
D. heard their murmuring 
 
4. “Is not David hiding himself on the hill of Hachilah; 
which is on the east of Jeshimon? The report above 
 
was made to King Saul by the 
A. Amalekites B. Philippines 
C. Hittites D. Ziphites 
 
5. ‘The LORD give you children by this woman. Eli 
offered this prayer because of Hannah’s 
A. love for the service 
B. loan of Samuel to the lord 
C. desire for more children from GOD 
D. faith in GOD 
 
6. The river that flowed out of Eden to water the garden 
divided and became four rivers namely 
A. Nile, Pishon, Euphrates and Tigris 
B. Pishon, Tigris, Gihon and Nile 
C. Gihon, Pishon, Tigris and Euphrates 
D. Pishon, Euphrates, Gihon and Jordan. 
 
7. King Rehoboam refused to take the counsel of 
the elders because 
A. it was wrong counsel 
B. he was afraid of the outcome of their counsel 
C. he was stubborn 
D. it was a turn of affairs brought about by the
